radiographic_examinations.findings: Severe prosthetic valve stenosis with peak/mean gradient of 149/98 mm Hg, dimensionless velocity index 0.28, aortic valve area was calculated at 0.8 cmÂ², no aortic valve regurgitation, mild concentric left ventricular hypertrophy with hyperdynamic left ventricular systolic function, and no evidence of pulmonary hypertension.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Rapidly progressive stenosis of a bioprosthesis that was functioning well only 1 year prior.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Confirmed severe bioprosthetic aortic stenosis; no evidence of thrombus, pannus formation, or valvular vegetation.
Functioning bioprosthetic aortic valve with peak/mean gradients of 43/27 mm Hg and no regurgitation, left ventricular ejection fraction >70%.
Normal aortic root with mild dilatation; adequate room for transcatheter valve placement; left main coronary artery widely patent.
Left main, left anterior descending, and left circumflex arteries were widely patent.
